It is important to set up your company information, including your address, logo, and time offset. Your address and logo will show up on reports and the time offset will set up your time zone.
1. Navigate to Settings > Company.

2. Complete the following: Table 1:
Setting | Description
Default Company Locale  drop-down | From the drop-down, select your company's locale. This will determine the language used in the system. Such as, English (United States); English (Australia), Italiana (Italia), etc. See below for Company Locale Examples. Your users can override the company setting in their profile. Learn how to change your language preference setting in the Update your Preferences article. Time Zone drop-down | From the drop-down, select the company's time zone. Each user can set their own time zone override, which will override the time zone chosen by the company. For example: Your company is in Texas, USA, and sets the database's Time Zone to Central. However, you work remotely in Florida, USA. Since you want to see all the entries displayed in the Eastern Time zone, you use the Time Zone Override, to override what the company's default displays. Default Sales Tax drop-down | From the drop-down, select the default sales tax. Fax field | Enter your company's fax number. Phone field | Enter your company's phone number. Address field | Enter your company's address. City field | Enter your company's city. State drop-down | From the drop-down, select the state. Zip field | Enter your company's zip code or postal code. Country drop-down | From the drop-down, select your company's country. Custom Printable Work Order drop-down | From the drop-down, select the custom printable work order. Custom Printable Purchase Order drop-down | From the drop-down, select the custom printable purchase order. Custom Printable Inspection drop-down | From the drop-down, select the custom printable inspections. Custom Printable Invoice drop-down | From the drop-down, select the custom printable invoice. Start fiscal year in drop-down | From the drop-down, select your company's fiscal year start month. Currency drop-down | From the drop-down, select your company's currency. If you change this setting, it will only change the currency symbol that is displayed. The currency amounts entered will not be converted.
3. Click the Save button and the settings are updated.

If your company is based outside the United States and/or if you have multi-lingual teams, then you can use localization to change the language (and date and time formats) and currency. Localization is configured from the company's default settings and individual users can override the setting.

The Default Company Locale in company settings is a global setting and it displays the application's interface in the selected language. This includes date, time, and number formats. Learn more in the Edit your Company Information article.
View the image(s) below:.

The languages available are: English (United States), English (Australia), English (Canada), English (Malaysia), English (United Kingdom), Deutsch (Deutschland),Espanol (Mexico), French (France), French (Canada), Italian (Italia), Dutch (Netherlands), Polish (Poland), Portuguese (Portugal), Portuguese (Brasil), Japanese (Japan), Chinese Simplified (China).

The Language (Region) Override setting (in your preferences) lets you override the global setting. The application displays the interface in your preferred language. This includes date, time, and currency formats.
View the image(s) below:.

The currency setting updates the currency symbol displayed throughout the application when you view costing information and reporting. The Default Company Locale and Language (Region) Override determines the placement of the symbol on a monetary value.
View the image(s) below:.
When an employee joins your company, you can create new employees to be users of Eptura Asset.
1. Navigate to Settings.
2. Under the Administration heading, click Employees & Users. The Employee Management screen displays.

3. Click the Create New Employee button and the Contact Profile form displays the following tabs to complete:Complete the Employee Type tab, Complete the Employee Details tab, Complete the Security Roles.
4. Complete the Employee Type tab.

4.1 In the Employee Type panel, select a type (this is a license type):  Full User - Has all features with Roles to control/restrict access, Mobile User - Has full mobile access with limited web access. Includes Email Alerts and Requests, Requester - Submit work to Request Portals. Limited communication with Asset Managers, Operator - Grants access to the Operator Companion to perform inspections, submit requests, and view asset information.
4.2 After you select an employee type, the Contact Profile form displays.
5. Complete the Employee Details tab.
5.1 In the User Id field, enter the unique identifier of the employee.
5.2 In the Full Name field, enter the full name of the employee.
5.3 Uncheck the Same as full name check box and then enter the employee's preferred name.
5.4 In the Email Address field, enter the email address of the employee.
5.5 In the Department field, enter the department the employee belongs to.
5.6 Click the Next button.
6. Complete the Security Roles.
You will need to grant the user access to the sites/entities they need.
6.1 Click the Add  icon.
6.2 From the Site drop-down, select the site and then the site displays.
6.3 Click the Save button and the employee is saved and the Contact Profile form displays.

Sites is the top level of organizing your assets in the application. Sites allow you to group together assets, people, and work orders that belong to a specific entity, in order to streamline which information is seen, and by whom. Each Site can have multiple groups below it. SITE 1 - Group 1, Group 2. SITE 2 - Group 1, Group 2. When managing teams in separate departments or buildings, it is important to differentiate what work belongs to them in a simple manner to avoid confusion and clutter. Sites can help you achieve this. After you have set up the sites your company needs, you will need to grant your users access.
1. Navigate to Settings.
2. Under the Administration heading, click Sites. The Site Settings screen displays.
Typically there is only a single region. If more than one region displays, then select the region first.
3. If there is only a single region, then hover over the region and click the + icon. A popup menu displays.
4. Click the Add Site. The Create a New Site dialog displays.
5. From the Region drop-down, select the region.
6. In the Site Name field, enter the name of the site.
7. From the Time Zone drop-down, select the time zone.
8. From the Distance Unit options, select either Metric or Imperial.
9. Check the Use Another Site's Budget check box if you want to use a different site's budget.
10. In the Reply To Email field, enter the reply to email address.
11. Click the Save Changes button. The site is saved.
1. Click the new site. The site's details form displays and contains the following tabs: Details, Payable Address, Warehouses, Labor Codes

This will help you to: Separate assets by Location, Narrow down work orders when filtering by Group, Increase reporting accuracy.

Budget Accounts help you track costs such as labor costs on Work Orders or purchasing inventory on Purchase Orders get logged as transactions against accounts.
This section lets you:.

1. Create Budgets and Budget Accounts - This activity may be something you do often for projects or when expanding to new sites or locations. For example: set up a budget account to track a capital improvement project. Set the default budget account for work orders assigned to this project to track those expenses separately from your general maintenance and repair budgets.
Note that you can do this activity programmatically with our Developer API if you want to keep your account list in sync with another system such as an accounting or ERP solution.

2. Complete Budget Planning - So that you can track spending by accounts or projects. You can choose to set budgeted amounts per account on a weekly or yearly basis, either way you have the flexibility to set goals and track spending.
3. View Budget Transactions - Track spending per budget account and you can see costs month by month or yearly.
In the Settings module, you will find the Budgets and Budget Accounts.
1. (A) Sites - Your Sites will have Budgets and Budget Accounts.
2. (B) Budgets - All Budget Accounts are placed under a Budget folder, will be bound by the properties of the main budget.
3. (C) Budget Accounts - All expenses will be tracked against one or more budget accounts.

By default, you will see the following: Operating folder will contain the Operation Costs budget with the budget account called Operation - All Operation Costs. Purchasing folder will contain the Purchasing Costs budget with the budget account called Purchasing - All Purchasing Costs. Revenue folder will contain the Revenue Transactions budget with the budget account called Revenue Transactions - Receivable Invoice Related Trans.

When you want to create a budget, the following can be created: Operating - This budget is used for most general maintenance costs and expense transactions. Such as Work Order expenses, Asset costs, etc. Purchasing - This budget is designed for Purchase Orders and Inventory adjustments. This shows how much is being spent to acquire the parts and hold on to them. Revenue - This budget is used for receivable invoicing transactions, which are  associated with the Invoicing Module.
You can have an unlimited number of budget accounts. After you have created your Budget Accounts, then you can edit the budget accounts to complete the budget planning.
When you want to find the budget transactions for a particular budget account, you can view or create these.
1. From the Budget Account screen, click on the budget and then click the budget account you want to view. The budget transactions for this month will display.
You can choose to set budgeted amounts per account on a monthly or yearly basis. This gives you the ability to set budget goals, and track your actual spending against those budgeted goals.
1. Monthly - Specify the budgeted amount for the months that require a budget.

2. Yearly - Specify your annual budgeted amount to be divided equally during the 12-month fiscal year. When divided equally, you can raise or lower any individual month; this adjustment is useful for months that require more budget.
You can specify the budgeted amount for the months that require a budget.
1. To start the planning, click the Budget Planning button.
The default when you open Budget Planning, is to establish a monthly budget. The current month will appear on the screen, with all Active accounts for the chosen budget.
2. For each budget account, enter the budgeted amount
3. Click the > arrow next to the month to proceed to the next month.
4. For each budget account, enter the budgeted amount.
5. Repeat steps 3 to 4 for the months that you need to set a budgeted amount for.

Specify your annual budgeted amount to be divided equally during the 12-month fiscal year. When divided equally, you can raise or lower any individual month; this adjustment is useful for months that require more budget.
1. To start the planning, click the Budget Planning button.
2. Click the Yearly  icon to display Adjusting Yearly Budget Amount.
The budget amount is divided equally across the 12-month fiscal year.
3. You can either check "This will override the all monthly budgets" check box OR leave it blank and this will apply the budget amount to those months without a entered budget amount.
The Budget will act as the "folder" for all of the Budget Accounts you create and assign to various assets and track expenses on work orders.

Every single account listed under that budget, MUST share the same budget properties. For example, if you establish an Operating budget, all the accounts placed under that budget will only be available for modules that use Operating budget accounts (Assets, Work Orders, etc).
1. From the menu, click Settings.
2. Under the Administration heading, click Budget Accounts.
3. Click the + icon in the top left corner of the screen to create a new budget.
The Choose a Budget Type dialog displays.

Select the budget type, either: Operating - This budget is used for most general maintenance costs and expense transactions. Such as Work Order expenses, Asset costs, etc.  Purchasing - This budget is designed for Purchase Orders and Inventory adjustments. This shows how much is being spent to acquire the parts and hold on to them. Revenue - This budget is used for receivable invoicing transactions, which are  associated with the Invoicing Module.
The New budget dialog displays.
7. In the Budget name field, enter the name.
8. In the Budget description field, enter the description.
9. Click the Create button to save.
The new budget folder will display in the budget list.
After the Budget is created, then you can create one or many budget accounts.

It is important to remember that every Budget Account listed under that budget, MUST share the same budget properties. For example, if you establish an Operating budget, all the Budget Accounts under that budget will only be available for modules that use Operating budget accounts, such as Assets, Work Orders, etc.

By default, the Administrator role is the only one to give you access to all six main Module permissions:.
1. Create - Allows the user to create a new record that did not exist previously.
2. Edit - With this permission, the user can add or alter documentation to an existing record (including change names, correct errors, add notes, change ID's, etc).

3. Delete - The record can be deleted entirely, with no possibility of recovery. Even if you have Delete rights, most modules will block you from deleting a record, if that record has any recorded history on it. This includes: Assets, Budgets, Employees, Inventory, PMs, Users, and Vendors.
4. View - The user can view any/all of the details of that module. Unless they have additional rights granted, this is all they can do inside the selected module.
5. Reports - The user can run any of the reports of the selected module.
6. Configure - This grants the user permission to change the settings of the selected module, and amend what options all other users will be able to see in the module.
On the right side of the screen, you will notice security settings that are unique for specific modules.
View the image(s) below:.
Let's clarify a few of these:.
1. Employees.
2. View Labor Rates - User and employees can see labor rates on Work Orders.
3. Inspections.
4. Restrict to Assigned - When turned ON, the user can ONLY see Inspections assigned to them.
5. Inventory.
6. Inventory - Include expected count in cycle count - This will allow you to export the cycle count parts with or without the expected count.
7. Purchase Orders.
8. Allow Qty Mismatch - This allows the purchase order to receive a different amount than was ordered. If you ordered 3 and only received 2, this allows the user to close the purchase order.
9. Work Orders.
10. Restrict to Assigned - When turned ON, the user can ONLY see Work Orders assigned to them.

content.title: Turn Full Administration Access ON vs granting specific Module Access.

content.text: When the Full Admin Access toggle is ON at the top of the screen then access to all the Module Settings is granted. It is NOT the same as manually granting the user Configure rights on all modules. It simply allows the user permission to open and view the module settings and the configure rights are still needed to make changes.

Full Admin Access is NOT necessary if the user only requires Configure rights to one or more modules. However, if they will also need control of Administration Tools, or global settings (such as Company addresses, Inventory warehouse setup, Asset Group/Location setup, etc. ), Full Admin Access will be required.

When you enable Microsoft Azure Single Sign On (SSO) in ManagerPlus, this will force the web app to authenticate users through your organization's Azure login policies.

content.title: Turn on the option to use Azure SSO.

content.text: Before connecting to your network's Single Sign-On, you need to enable SSO in ManagerPlus.
1. Go to Settings > Tools and Support > Marketplace.
2. Find the SSO (Single Sign On) option, and slide the button to the right to turn on the feature.
3. When switched on, the Settings > Administration section will now display the Single Sign-on (SSO) settings Icon.
Next, enable Azure's SSO in ManagerPlus:.
1. Go to Settings > Administration  > Single Sign-On (SSO).
2. Switch on Azure Sign-On Enabled.
Now you can configure which domains can log in to your ManagerPlus database, by completing each field.
Explanation of fields and options:.
3. Add Row - Use this option to create your first domain entry or add additional domains. Adding additional domains will allow you to configure settings differently per ManagerPlus entity.
4. Domain  – This filters which domains are allowed to access your ManagerPlus.
5. Site – This is the default site/entity that will be used when new users are created – the new user will be registered under this site.

6. Default Security User Role – New users will be registered with this security role when signing in for the first time from the main application. Note:  By default, this setting is set to not [Don't Create User].

7. Default Mobile User Role – New users will be registered with this security role when signing in for the first time from a mobile device. Note:  By default, this setting is set to not auto create users.
8. Click the Save Changes button.
After enabling your SSO settings in ManagerPlus, log out of your current ManagerPlus session.
Now that your SSO connection settings have been configured, it's time to log back into ManagerPlus.
Open your ManagerPlus Lightning website and you will notice that login page has changed.
View the image(s) below:.
1. Click the Microsoft Sign In button.
2. Sign in as an Azure Administrator.
Accept the requested app permissions.
After accepting, you will be granted access to the ManagerPlus application.
After you have successfully logged in then ManagerPlus will be registered into your Azure Instance.

An API (Application Programming Interface) connector is a tool that allows the application to share data with other business applications you may use, making it easier to get more done in one place. This will allow you to gather data in a central location. The data can be used to create reports, dashboards, and graphs in our Business Intelligence tool, giving you unprecedented insight into your business operations.

In order for connectors to work, they need to sync with ManagerPlus. That can be done by gathering the connectors database name, email address, password, and ensuring that you get a dedicated service account that is API enabled. Once these items have been gathered, you will need to reach out to our technical support team who will help set up the connector for you.
View the image(s) below:.

content.title: API changes now in effect with the release of API Version 2.

content.text: For developers using the API, see the API V2 Documentation. The now-deprecated API V1 will be discontinued October 1, 2021.
The following is a list of changes that will impact your ability to connect to ManagerPlus:.

• API keys will no longer be accepted in the query string (like `. api_key=. `). API keys must now be provided in the Authorization header (like `Authorization:. `). This change prevents API keys from being saved in server logs—both our server logs and other Internet operators' logs.
• Note that customers' existing API keys will continue to work.
• The API URL is changing from `/api` to `/api2`.

content.title: Additional changes that don't cause breakage for customers or their API integrations:.

content.text: • Code and infrastructure have been updated under the hood. We're hoping to see performance improvements.
• The documentation UI is different. It should provide the same information.
• New endpoints have been added, including information about entities (sites), with more on the way.

• The capitalization of some parameters has changed in the documentation, but all of those should be case insensitive. Old cases should still work. If they don't, it's a bug, though it's probably one of low priority.
• Some API methods (mostly PATCH requests) now have different, improved error messages.
• API keys can now be managed directly in the application. They are still available to manage in Classic.
